channel.title: A few changes
channel.description:
Some of you will have noticed that I made some changes to the way the rank works. Those changes are:
[ol][li]The rank 'Moparscape Vet' no longer appears in your profile or under your names when you post in topics.[/li] [li]Your name is no longer yellow in the user list at the bottom of the page[/li][/ol]
There's only really one reason for this. People are voting people in, or attempting to vote them out, based on things other than programming skill and overall brilliance. Things like maturity were coming into play, despite the fact that having access to this section and holding a moderator rank are two very different things.
One of the reasons for this, in my opinion, is the fact that some members don't want to be lumped in with less desirable users. So to fix that problem, everyone is now disassociated from each other.
So to sum up, this section is development centric -- always has been, always will be. Nominate people for access based on the fact that they can program well, and thus contribute to development. Don't nominate people because they're 'nice', or 'mature enough for the rank' -- we have rewards for helpers anyway.

item.title: A few changes
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

Global moderators have access by default jme, just as they do with the community member section on moparisthebest.com.

The difference is that global moderators are able to moderate both this section and the community member section. The moparscape moderators don’t actually moderate this section, but were given the rank mostly for the yellow name… which I can’t think of a way to reintroduce without giving them some sort of primary rank.

Read full topic

item.title: A few changes
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

I joined this “scene” almost 7 years ago only to leech runescape cheats. But as years went by I gained a sort of love for the community. I want to see it thrive and I like to be involved with it. That’s why it would hurt to see my access removed. Because I have my own selfish need to always know what’s going on with the place.

But like I said I only ever joined to leech off other peoples work. I have no programming ability to bring to the table, so if you’re removing members just remember I’m no use here

Read full topic

item.title: A few changes
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

I was just looking for clarification, Lothy, because most of us were on different pages here. Your original focus was programming, Mopar’s was a chilling section, and then each of us have our own spin-offs. I personally don’t care which way we go, I’d just like to pick the way that furthers this system the most. I can’t see development doing very well, considering the general programming board on this site does far worse than the general discussion or server-related boards (and that being the shitty side of the server-related programming).

Read full topic

item.title: A few changes
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

There’s no value in having hidden ‘general discussion’ sections.
What sort of general discussion would take place here that couldn’t possibly take place in the already very well established public general discussion section?

You can see the MITB CM general discussion section, and you know that it’s dead as dead.
If someone wants to cool off then they can go for a swim, or grab a beer or something and relax.

Regarding people that help: we have an award for that now.
All of those helpers are only motivated by the fact that they receive such an award (or previously, the Vet rank) for their work anyway.
Just look at how many ‘good’ people/helpers QQ and quit because they aren’t asked to be moderators.
I Vain I being the most recent that I’m aware of, as it was discussed in his poll.
There have been others too, not that I can remember their names.

Finally, Silab and I handpicked initial Moparscape Vets based on the fact that they could program.
Obviously polls have been started over time and new people have gained access, but it was our intention to keep the section for devs.
Didn’t really think that something like that would have to be written down – always regarded it as obvious. I can fix that later though.

Read full topic

item.title: A few changes
item.dc:creator: @meiscooldude meiscooldude
item.description:
@meiscooldude wrote:

Personally, I would like to see it be switched from ‘Vet’ to ‘CM’, simply to avoid future confusion (if a rank is instated)

Read full topic

item.title: A few changes
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

[quote=“meiscooldude, post:25, topic:379088”]@Taharok, You got me confused now too. What is the difference between CM and Vet? Are there CM’s on MoparScape? (These aren’t things I usually pay attention to)

In general though, I do believe this discussion has exposed at least some desire by those in this community to have some sort of separation between development and general discussion. It could be solved easily by adding a ‘Vet Development’ section along with the current ‘Vet Talk’ and ‘Vet Polls’.[/quote]

This rank represents “MoparScape CM,” it’s predecessor. It’s a simple reflection of Moparisthebest CM, which is a general discussion board. Granted, CM also had a development board, before the CC’s qqed and gobbled it up. How about you just make a dev board for the Vets, reinstate the rank, then we can all sit down and figure out what the true requisites should be for having this rank.

Read full topic

item.title: A few changes
item.dc:creator: @meiscooldude meiscooldude
item.description:
@meiscooldude wrote:

@Taharok, You got me confused now too. What is the difference between CM and Vet? Are there CM’s on MoparScape? (These aren’t things I usually pay attention to)

In general though, I do believe this discussion has exposed at least some desire by those in this community to have some sort of separation between development and general discussion. It could be solved easily by adding a ‘Vet Development’ section along with the current ‘Vet Talk’ and ‘Vet Polls’.

Other thought: If CM is only MITB, and Vet is MoparScape, perhaps it would be better to have a standard.

Read full topic

item.title: A few changes
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

Without a notable rank, we do need some sort of way to identify the vets. We need to setup a list or something.

Edit: Okay I’m confused. I’ve been in this section since it was created from the get-go. When have we ever been development-centric, lothy? No topics have been made saying, “this section is for development purposes.” The introductory sticky implies this is supposed to be like MITB CM. It’s a generic discussion board for people who have earned the rank and want a place to cool off, or just to post something they don’t want everyone else to know. We talk less about development in this section than just general discussion.

How about we actually use this rank for it’s real purpose? Add the people who’ve been active for over 2 years, add the people who contribute 5 hours a day to the community, add the people who understand the thorough concepts of the client and protocol, add the people who have earned multiple awards and are extremely helpful. That could sound like a lot, but it’s hardly any. If you want a hidden development group, you’re going to lose most of the veterans we had before. What’s the point?

Read full topic

@deathschaos9 wrote:

I found some of the older threads in this board rather interesting, but I wouldn’t miss having access. I know I wont be bringing anything new or groundbreaking to this board anytime soon.

Also, will MoparScape moderators have colored names on the online list in the future so we stand out again?

Read full topic

item.title: A few changes
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

The section isn’t going anywhere. You guys need to decide whether having access is really for you.
You lose absolutely nothing now in terms of status, so there’s no reason not to bow out if you’re not really that interested in the happenings of this section.

Moderators were given the vet rank so that their names stood out. It was indeed a bit of laziness on the part of the administration team.
I might change that so that moderators don’t have access to this section (unless they were voted in before receiving moderator).
Would any of you moderators actually miss your access to this section?

Finally, the name ‘Moparscape Vet’ was a bit of a misnomer. I received PMs here and there from users that automatically assumed they should get the rank because they had been around since 2006/2007.

Anyway guys, this change couldn’t be more timely. Mopar is finalising a deal with someone who has sold him a server (which will be released under the AGPL licence) – everyone on this website is going to have the opportunity to show that they’ve got what it takes for access to this section; you guys just need to spot the good eggs, start a poll for them, and reference their contributions to the new server.

Read full topic

item.title: A few changes
item.dc:creator: @m.dog311 m.dog311
item.description:
@m.dog311 wrote:

meiscooldude:

I think it would be appropriate to ask the question whether a vet position is actually a good idea.

I think it should continue to be around, but we need to have a set guideline on what should be considered a vet.

Also, I know this is a RSPS based site, and a majority of the development in these sections is going to be based around RSPS, but what about those of us who don’t know much about the client & protocol, but still have things we can offer to this section? And what about those of us who have things that we would like to release privately, maybe for testing and bug finding before a public release? Yes there are the CM section(s) over at MITB, but a lot of the people who have access to these sections don’t have access to the CM section(s). Anyone that actually has something useful to offer to these sections should be admitted, not just those who have something to offer that is Runescape related.

Read full topic

item.title: A few changes
item.dc:creator: @meiscooldude meiscooldude
item.description:
@meiscooldude wrote:

I know given that I am a ‘vet’ I am in no position to suggest what the standards should be.

But personally I see no problem with high standards

http://www.ets.org/Media/Tests/GRE/pdf/CompSci.pdf

Also I suggest a minimum time being an ‘active’ member. Perhaps a minimum number of posts per day over a year or two.

(And yes, that test was somewhat a joke, but I believe a vet should be able to answer some questions of that level)

Read full topic
